title: Geography Project
name: Geography Project
description:
A Map by Stephaniedenise

This map shows where I live, where I have family and where I have visited!

properties.name: Auschwitz Birkenau
properties.description: Posted by StephaniedenisePolandAuschwitz was the largest Nazi concentration camp in Poland, an extermination camp. Nazis were a group of people created by Hitler. Auschwitz was a camp used during WWII where Jews and other people such as homosexuals were killed. About 90% of the prisoners were Jews and the main death was caused by gas chambers, other deaths were caused by starvation, forced labor, individual executions and medical experiments. Construction on this camp begin in October 1941. Birkenau had four gas chambers and four crematoria used to incinerate bodies. 20,000 people could be gassed and cremated each day. Sleeping conditions were bad and diseases were spreading fast. The prisoners had very little food; sometimes they would ever steal each others food. Also the SS guards made the prisoners strip down and hand over all their valuables, this camp was a death camp and it ended early in 1944.

properties.name: Big Ben
properties.description: Posted by StephaniedeniseLondonBig Ben the 316ft Clock was completed between 1858-59. This clock got its name from Sir Benjamin Hall, the first commissioner of works. Big Ben was first to broadcast on New Years Eve in 1923. The Clock itself weights 13 tons. Big Ben\'s story began two decades before it was built. When the Palace of Westminster caught on fire many things were destroyed, but what survived is in what we know today the Westminster Hall. Parliament decided to build a tower with a clock and bell. This was to celebrate the new year of the 11th hour, day, and year, the start of the WWI. Big Ben is a famous symbol of parliament.

properties.name: Colosseum
properties.description: Posted by StephaniedeniseThe Colosseum is an elliptical amphitheatre in Rome,Italy. It is one of the greatest works of Roman architecture and engineering. The Colosseum construction started in 70-72 AD under the emperor Vespasian and was completed 80 AD under Titus. It was capable of seating around 50,000 spectators. The Colosseum was used for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles. The last game that was recorded to be held there was the 6th century. Later the building was ceased for any entertainment in the early medieval era. It now is in a ruined condition because of earthquakes and stone-robbers. The Colosseum is been seen as an iconic symbol of Imperial Rome. Today it is one of Rome\'s most popular tourists attraction. Also the Colosseum has close connections with the Roman Catholic Church, as each Good Friday the Pope lights a torchlit meaning, "Way of the Cross" procession to the amphitheatre. The building was constructed by emperors of the Flavian Dynasty. The Colosseum has been around for a long time and has History.

properties.name: Grand Canyon
properties.description: Posted by StephaniedeniseAriozna The Grand Canyon was a home to many Pueblo Indians and is now known as a national park since 1918. The Grand Canyon National park is one of the first national parks in the United States. Today the national park receives close to five million visitors each year. Many people also visit the first hotel ever built their which was the El Tovar and was built right on the rim of the Canyon. The Grand Canyons formation is caused by the course of the Colorado River. In 1882 Sir Benjamin Harrison introduces a first bill to create the Grand Canyon national Park; in 1918 it becomes a national park. Also President Teddy Roosevelt creates a Grand Canyon national monument in 1908. The Grand Canyon is 18 miles wide and 5000 feet deep, and is 227 miles long. The Grand Canyon is known for its beautiful land and incredible size.

properties.name: Great Wall of China
properties.description: Posted by StephaniedeniseChinaThe Great Wall of China is one of the greatest wonders in the world, it stretches east to west of China and is 4163 miles long. The wall of China was used for defensive protection from three states which are Yan, Zhao and Qin. It went through many repairs and many states claimed the parts of the wall. The Great Wall never became itself until the Qin Dynasty. This wall has served as a monument of the Chinese nation. Many soldiers, prisoners and local people built the wall. The wall has been incorporated with Chinese mythology and popular symbols. The Great Wall was built out of stone and wood frames. Also this is a main attraction for tourism, the wall receives thousands of tourists each day. In 1987 the Great Wall of China was made a heritage site.

properties.name: MT. Rushmore
properties.description: Posted by StephaniedeniseSouth DakotaMt. Rushmore was renamed after Charles E. Rushmore a New York Lawyer during an expedition in 1885. The project of carving Rushmore was to increase tourism in the Black Hills region of South Dakota. The carving begin in 1927 and ended in 1941. The carving was of four Presidents George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Theodore Roosevelt and Abraham Lincoln. President Calvin Coolidge insisted that along with Washington that two republicans and one democrat be portrayed. Mt. Rushmore\'s carvings were to represent the first 150 years of American history. Gutzon Borglum and 400 workers sculpted the colossal 60 foot carvings. Borglum selected the Presidents because of their role in preserving the Republic and expanding its territory. Borglum died from embolism in 1941 before he finished the carvings but his son Lincoln finished it. The mountain was carved out of dynamite and tools such as air hammers. The entire project cost 989,992.32, no workers died during the project.

properties.name: Sistine Chapel
properties.description: Posted by StephaniedeniseRomeThe Sistine Chapel is best known as being the home of the Pope in the Vatican City. Its fame rest on its architecture, Michelangelo was the artist of the Sistine Chapel. The Sistine Chapel is a high rectangular brick building, which is common in many Medieval Renaissance churches in Italy. The internal spaces of the building are divided into three stories of which the lowest is huge with a robustly vaulted basement with several utilitarian windows. Above is the main space and the third story vault rises with wardrooms for guards. During occasional ceremonies of importance the side walls are covered with a series of tapestries. One of the most significant functions of the Sistine Chapel is a venue for the election of each successive pope.

properties.name: Statue of Liberty
properties.description: Posted by StephaniedeniseNew York CityThe Statue of Liberty has been here since 1886 and it was a gift from the people of France of recognition of the friendship established during the American Revolution. The statue has been a symbol of freedom and democracy. Their also is another Statue of Liberty which was the first model and is in Luxembourg, Paris. The designer of the Statue is Frederic Bartholdi. Bartholdi thought it was the perfect gift to celebrate America\'s centennial. The Statue weighs 450,000 pounds. The Island where it sits was renamed to Liberty Island. Also the Statue of Liberty is well known for an entry point of immigrants. The Statue of Liberty is not just a monument it is a symbol of freedom to the people of this world.

properties.name: Sydney Opera House
properties.description: Posted by StephaniedeniseAustraliaThe Sydney Opera House in Australia is the world\'s most distinctive 20th century building and one of the most famous performing arts venues in the world. The Opera House is near the Sydney Harbour Bridge and it attracts many tourists and it is the home of Opera Australia. The Opera House began in the late 1940s when Eugene Goossens lobbied for large theatrical productions, by 1954 Goossens gained support of Joseph Cahill. By 1957 Jorn Uzton design was announced. The Construction began in March 1959 and was built in three stages, Stage I podium (1959-1963), Stage II roof (1963-1967) and Stage III interior (1967-1973). The Opera House was formally completed in 1973 with the cost of 102 million. On October 20, 1973 the Opera House was open by Queen Elizabeth II, Queen of Australia, millions attended. The first performance was on September 28, 1973 of Sergei Prokofiev\'s who played War and Peace. Uzton the designer of the Opera House has a room renamed after him and the Sydney Trust in 1999 appointed him as a future consultant for work.

properties.name: White House
properties.description: Posted by StephaniedeniseWashington D.C.The White House has stood as a symbol of presidency, government and America\'s people. John Adams was the first President to live in the White House, in the 1800s. In 1814 the White House survived a fire caused by the British in the war of 1812 and another fire in the west wing in 1929 while Herbert Hoover was President. Thomas Jefferson was the first to hold a open house in 1805. The White House is a unique home that is designed as the person living in it wants which many people, Presidents have lived their. The White House has 6 floors, 132 rooms and 35 bathrooms. The oval office was created when President William Henry Taft expanded the west wing. The designer of the White House was Pierre L\' Enfant which is now 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue.
